definition: things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: Dr. Cutler’s research suggests that this is self-defeating behavior.
sentences.chinese: 卡特勒博士的研究表明這是一種事與願違的行爲。

sentences.english: Also, this is why changing menus dynamically sometimes backfires .
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼動態地改變菜單有時候事與願違。

sentences.english: It hasn't been: Apple sold 9.25 million iPads last quarter.
sentences.chinese: 然而事與願違，上季度iPad售出925萬臺。

sentences.english: However, this approach can back fire if it triggers a price-cutting spiral.
sentences.chinese: 然而事與願違的是，這條途徑可能引發商家競相降價。

sentences.english: That may change the North’s behavior, but it could backfire.
sentences.chinese: 這有可能改變北韓的行爲，但是也可能事與願違。

sentences.english: Many things in our lives go by contraries .
sentences.chinese: 我們生活中有許多事與願違的情況。

sentences.english: Among other personality types, this compensation usually backfires .
sentences.chinese: 在其它的人格類型中，這種補償通常會事與願違。
如果魔鬼訓練事與願違咋辦？

sentences.english: Many things in our lives go by - ries.
sentences.chinese: 生活中的許多事情都是事與願違。

sentences.english: Instead, he said, people got "a whimper, not a scream."
sentences.chinese: 事與願違，人們報之以“嗚咽，而非驚叫”。

sentences.english: Counterproductive, who is cruel to hurt someone?
sentences.chinese: 線事與願違，是誰狠心傷害了誰？

sentences.english: Honesty is a friend of you, partner of hypocrisy is counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 誠信是心想事成的朋友，虛僞是事與願違的伴侶。

sentences.english: His plan backfired on him, and he lost all his money.
sentences.chinese: 他的計劃事與願違，因此他的錢全虧掉了。

sentences.english: And if things truly are against you, see No. 8.
sentences.chinese: 然而如果事情真地都事與願違，那麼看第8點。

sentences.english: And it has had other untoward effects.
sentences.chinese: 而且它還有其他事與願違的效應。

definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to force someone to do something
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
